p: Pinostrobin (2S-5-hidroxy-7-metoxy-2-phenyl-2,3-di-hydrocromen-4-one) ( Figure 5) is flavanone obtained from Boesenbergia rotunda ( Zingiberaceae) used for the treatment of gastrointestinal disorders, including peptic ulcer. These constituents present diverse biological activities, including antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, antiviral, and anticancer properties [ 108]. In the ethanol-induced ulcer model in rats, it protected the gastric mucosa, with inhibitory effects in COX-2 enzyme (20 and 40 mg/kg, p.o.), with omeprazole (20 mg/kg) as a positive control [ 109].
